thread.title: Does Donald Trump Know How To Shake Hands? An Investigation
thread.title_full: Does Donald Trump Know How To Shake Hands? An Investigation

author: Maxwell Strachan
title: Does Donald Trump Know How To Shake Hands? An Investigation
text:
Does Donald Trump Know How To Shake Hands? An Investigation The answer is definitive. Maxwell Strachan Senior Editor, The Huffington Post Twitter and YouTube Just doing our job. 
The internet is on fire talking about a handshake. Specifically, a handshake between U.S. President Donald Trump and Japanese Prime Minister Shinzō Abe . It’s a weird handshake that goes on far too long even for Abe’s liking. Seriously. Twitter 
Which begs the question: Does Donald Trump know how to shake hands with a fellow human being? We decided to take a deep dive in and find out. What we found is that the president has a tendency to pull powerful men toward him in a way that jerks them forward. It’s, uh, kind of strange. Don’t believe us? Here’s some proof. 
Here he is doing it with former CNBC talk show host Donny Deutsch . YouTube 
And here he is doing it with former “Apprentice” winner Bill Rancic . Notice he won’t let Rancic win. YouTube 
Here, in a handshake with Secretary of State Rex Tillerson , the forcefulness of both men leads to an awkward game of tug of war. Twitter 
Even Vice President Mike Pence is not immune to the Trump tug. YouTube 
Nor is a very sad-looking Neil Gorsuch , Trump’s pick for the Supreme Court. YouTube 
When Mitt Romney shook Trump’s hand a few years back, he tried to fight the tug. And he failed. YouTube 
Somewhat oddly, Shinzō Abe didn’t get the full tug on Friday. Twitter 
But he was clearly weirded out by the Trump handshake experience all the same. Twitter 
So, does Donald Trump know how to shake hands? We’re going to go with no. Also on HuffPost Medieval Trump Parody Account 11 Medieval Trump Parody Account
